Art Department Staff - Art and Art Professions - NYU Steinhardt                                                         Skip to content         NYU Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development           apply now     request info     contact                                      Department of Art and Art Professions            NYU Art Facebook    NYU Art Twitter            Art and Art Professions                 MFA     MA          Art Education      Art Therapy      Costume Studies      Visual Arts Administration             Undergraduate          BFA Studio Art      Minors             About          Exhibitions      Events        Facilities      Faculty      Staff      Student Resources      Internships      Summer                              About    Exhibitions    Events    Facilities    Faculty    Staff    Student Resources    Internships    Summer    Donate                                 Art Department Staff       Tammy Brown  Planning and Communications  Department planning, calendar, student exhibition program in the Commons and Rosenberg Galleries, public events, student events, website, fundraising, internal communications, and external promotion. Adviser for all student clubs. Liaison with NYU Development, Public Affairs, and Marketing.  Ken Castronuovo  Department Administrator Administration, finance and budget questions, faculty appointments, administrative technology, purchase approvals, and honoraria requests. Damien Davis Administrative Aide Grading, class lists and current enrollment, emergency class cancellations, syllabi, course descriptions and evaluations. Administrative support for Arts Professions.  Dustin Foster  Digital Labs Manager  Supervises all operations of studios including scheduling, staffing, user assistance, software management, hardware integrity, and planning for future needs.    Sarah Gill  Studio Operations Administrator Ben Hatcher Exhibitions Coordinator  Alex Jovanovich Undergraduate Academic Advisor Academic advisement for BFA, study abroad, and minors, as well as departmental recruitment and admission activities for the undergraduate program. Co-teaches the New Student Seminar, designed to assist new students, both freshmen and transfers, in their transition to the university, the Steinhardt School, the art department ,and New York City.  Vonetta Moses Administrative Secretary Classroom and adjunct support including audiovisual equipment (campus media requests), book requisitions, photocopies, supplies, and model requests. Requests for checks for: petty cash, honoraria, business payments. Adjunct appointment forms.   Hugh O'Rourke Manager, 80WSE Gallery Administrative duties for the department's art gallery, including scheduling, condition reports, loan agreements, insurance, website administration, announcement design, and budget reporting; liaises with artists, curators, collectors, critics, and press.     Mary Ann Santos  Senior Advisement and Student Affairs Administrator Academic advisement, recruitment, and admission activities for MFA Studio Art program.  E rin Sircy  Graduate Art Professions Adviser One-on-one graduate student advisement. Course scheduling, room requests, syllabus collection, course evaluations, and registration issues. Linda Vega Intermin Internship Advisor  Internship in Art Course: one-on-one graduate and undergraduate student advisement. Internship/job posting. Liaison with prospective internship sponsors and employers. Information on grants, awards and residencies as well as technical assistance for students and faculty including review of grant applications, research, and other forms of support.     Gustabo Velazquez  Sculpture Shop Administrator Manages the day-to-day operations of the sculpture shops for wood, plaster, and metals. Juliet Vinegra Artist and Student Resources Provides Internships and Jobs in the Arts weekly listings and Opportunities for Artists monthly listings.    Jen Zakrzewski Manager, Darkroom and Photo Cage  Manages the day-to-day operations of the photo lab for color and black and white.
